A good potting mix is important for container-grown peach trees, as it provides the tree with the necessary nutrients and drainage. Here are some tips on selecting a good potting mix for your Bonanza Peach:

1. Choose a mix that is well-draining, as peach trees do not like to sit in water. Look for a mix that contains perlite, vermiculite, or coarse sand to promote good drainage. 2. Look for a mix that is nutrient-rich but not overly fertile, as excessive fertilization can lead to poor fruit quality. Avoid mixes that contain high levels of nitrogen, as this can promote vegetative growth at the expense of fruit production. 3. You can create your own mix by combining equal parts of high-quality potting soil, perlite or vermiculite, and compost. 4. Alternatively, you can buy a commercial potting mix that is specifically formulated for fruit trees. These mixes usually contain a balanced blend of nutrients and drainage materials. 5. Be sure to choose a pot that is at least 15 gallons in size and has good drainage holes to allow excess water to escape. Whatever mix you choose, be sure to repot your peach tree every few years to refresh the growing medium and ensure continued growth and productivity.
